prompt: Photorealistic close-up macro shot of a single, ornate brass drawer pull attached to a dark, polished mahogany chest of drawers. The handle is a bail pull with intricate floral detailing, showing slight tarnish and wear consistent with age.  Soft, directional light from the upper left highlights the texture and patina.  The background is blurred, emphasizing the handle.  Shallow depth of field.  The composition is a horizontal slice, with the handle centered and the drawer extending to the edges of the frame.  Style:  Museum-quality photography. --ar 16:9
name: identify-antique-furniture-by-handles-image-1.png

prompt: A wide shot showcasing a collection of various antique furniture handles and knobs, arranged on a dark velvet cloth.  The handles represent different styles and eras:  a delicate porcelain knob, a heavy iron ring pull, a carved wooden handle, a brass escutcheon plate, and a teardrop-shaped bail pull.  The lighting is soft and even, coming from above, highlighting the details of each piece.  The velvet cloth is slightly rumpled, adding texture.  The composition is arranged like a still life, with the handles spread across the horizontal plane. Style:  Product photography, informative. --ar 16:9
name: identify-antique-furniture-by-handles-image-2.png

prompt: A medium shot of a craftsman's hand, holding a small magnifying glass, examining the back of an antique brass drawer pull.  The pull is detached from the furniture.  The hand is weathered and shows signs of age, suggesting expertise.  The background is a cluttered workbench with various tools (chisels, small hammers, screwdrivers) partially visible, but out of focus.  Warm, natural light filters in from a window on the right side of the frame.  The composition emphasizes the detail and inspection process. Style:  Documentary photography. --ar 16:9
name: identify-antique-furniture-by-handles-image-3.png

prompt: A split-screen comparison. On the left side, a close-up of a genuine antique brass bail pull with subtle imperfections, a slightly uneven surface, and a warm, aged patina. On the right side, a close-up of a modern reproduction of the same style, showing a perfectly uniform surface, a brighter, more consistent color, and sharper edges.  The lighting is identical on both sides â€“ bright and direct, highlighting the differences.  A thin white line divides the two halves. The composition is a perfect horizontal split. Style:  Comparative, educational photography. --ar 16:9
name: identify-antique-furniture-by-handles-image-4.png

prompt: A wide shot of an antique dresser, partially visible, with a focus on one drawer. The drawer features a pair of matching, ornate brass drop pulls with backplates. The dresser is made of dark, aged wood with visible grain and some minor scratches. The lighting is dramatic, with a single spotlight highlighting the drawer and pulls, creating strong shadows and contrast. The background is a dark, blurred interior, possibly a room in an old house. The composition places the drawer and handles slightly off-center to the right, leaving ample space on the left. Style:  Atmospheric, dramatic photography. --ar 16:9
name: identify-antique-furniture-by-handles-image-5.png
